thread.title: Virgin Australia forecasts bluer skies ahead as full-year losses reduced | Travel | Travel News Holiday Deals | |
thread.title_full: Virgin Australia forecasts bluer skies ahead as full-year losses reduced | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: Glen Norris, AAP
title: Virgin Australia forecasts bluer skies ahead as full-year losses reduced | Travel | Travel News Holiday Deals | |
text:
STRUGGLING Virgin Australia says its losses are narrowing as it controls costs and sees an improved performance from its Tigerair subsidiary.
The Brisbane-based company said it was set to post a $93.8 million full-year loss, an improvement
on the $355.6 million the airline lost in 2013-14.
The group’s underlying loss, which includes certain one-off costs, is set to be $49 million, which is better than the $65 million loss analysts had expected.
“The result represents a significant year on year improvement for the seasonally weaker June quarter,” chief financial officer Sankar Narayan said.
Mr Narayan said the airline had achieved success in attracting high-yielding market segments. Virgin will release its official full-year results on August 7.
KGB Interview: Virgin Australia 20:21 Play video
Virgin Australia CEO John Borghetti speaks to Kohler, Gottliebsen and Bartholomeusz about the airline's financial performance, and outlook.
The Australian 20 Feb 2015 Business Business/KGB TV Originally published as Virgin forecasts bluer skies ahead
